title: Bible typeface
content:
This face was used in a NASB I have, an NIV Study Bible, and on the back cover, as pictured, of another Bible I have. Been hugely curious what font it is.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020030301im_/http:/typophile.com/files/test_5434.JPG)
author: metalfoot

comments.content: Yes, that's it exactly, unless it exists in other names...

The Weidemann typeface's original name was Biblica, which was designed for the collaborative publication of a Bible by the German Catholic and Protestant Churches. — [Linotype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020030301/http:/www.linotype.com/13028/itcweidemannbold-font.html#info)
Yep. I saw that. It's an interesting design, in my opinion, although the italics strike me as little more than a leaned-over form of the regular form...
